subject: Philosophy
title: Science and Religion
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Science and Religion.

hook.text: Science says the universe is billions of years old. Some scriptures say thousands. Can both be right?

buildup.text: The conflict model says science and religion are incompatible. One must yield to the other.

discovery.text: Stephen Jay Gould proposed 'non-overlapping magisteria': science handles facts; religion handles meaning.

twist.text: But they do overlap. Evolution, cosmology, and neuroscience all make claims that touch religious territory.

climax.text: The relationship is complex. Many great scientists were devout. Many religious claims have been scientifically refuted.

punchline.text: They answer different questions. Trouble starts when they don't.

quiz.question: What did Gould mean by 'non-overlapping magisteria'?
options: Science and religion address different domains: facts and meaning
